title: How To Find High Demand Low Competition Math Workbook Niches on KDP

tactics.name: Niche Down with Amazon Search
tactics.description: Use Amazon search bar and SPT extensions to identify low-competition math niches by combining school levels, age groups, and math operations.
steps: Use Amazon search bar to input math topics (e.g., division).
Install and activate SPT extensions: Best Free KDP Research Tools and Amazon Suggestion Expander.
Combine math operations with grade levels (e.g., division workbook third grade).
caveats: Avoid generic terms like 'math workbook' without specific niching
source_quotes: if you have the software then just create an interior which you haven't put much effort into and then create a real simple math cover as well again which you haven't put much effort into and then target something like math workbook and then just do that that's not going to cut it

tactics.name: search_and_analyze
tactics.description: Use search terms to find niches and analyze BSR, review counts, and publication dates
steps: Input niche keywords into search bar
Check search result count and BSR averages
Identify independently published books on first page
Compare review counts and publication years
caveats: Low competition niches may still have low demand
source_quotes: if we look here this is high demand because if we look at that bestseller rank the average is around 78 000

tactics.name: Keyword Title Targeting
tactics.description: Prioritize niches where target keywords are in the title to improve ranking despite lower reviews
steps: Identify niches with low competition keywords in titles
Compare rankings between high review books without targeted keywords
caveats: Reviews may not matter if keywords are not targeted in titles
source_quotes: this is basic multiplication workbook for kids so most of these keywords are in the title

heuristics.name: Low Review Niche Boost
heuristics.condition: If niche has low review counts and moderate BSR, prioritize for low competition
source_quotes: this is why you need both because this one just here is going to give you all the other suggestions on amazon and then the other tool let's just get off of here the other tool is going to give you a niche score and tell you if it's profitable

heuristics.name: review_threshold_heuristic
heuristics.condition: If average reviews are below 200, prioritize niche
source_quotes: anything below a thousand isn't too bad

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with targeted keywords
source_quotes: reviews does not matter too much depending on what you're targeting

claims.statement: KDP allows 300+ math niche templates as a bonus for software purchasers
Independently published books on first page indicate KDP success
source_quotes: if we look here this is published in 2018 and it's through createspace and that's now known as kdp

claims.statement: Books with no reviews can outrank high-review books if keywords are targeted in titles
source_quotes: this first one has no reviews the competition is really low

niche_patterns.example: division workbook + third grade math practice + low competition
niche_patterns.description: Combine math operations with specific grade levels to create hyper-targeted niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Balances demand (educational need) with low competition (niched audience)
source_quotes: this is how you start finding niches or sub niches within the math niche
